crime. He longed to kiss his fa- ther's hands and kneel to beg his forgiveness, but said, in a careless and even rude voice, that it happens to everyone! 
The old count cast down his eyes on hearing his son's words and began bustlingly searching for something. 
"Yes, yes," he muttered, "it will be difficult, I fear, difficult to raise . . . happens to every- body! Yes, who has not done it?" 
And with a furtive glance at his son's face, the count went out of the room. . . . Nicholas had
